com.amitinside.featureflags.strategy

Interface ActivationStrategy


  • public interface ActivationStrategy
    This interface represents a custom strategy for deciding whether a Strategizable instance will be active or not.

    Currently Feature and FeatureGroup instances are Strategizable.

    Strategy names getName() should be globally unique (case-insensitive). If multiple strategies have the same name, the strategy with the highest service ranking is accessible through the FeatureService service while those with lower service rankings are ignored. If service rankings are equal, sort by service ID in descending order. That is, services with lower service IDs will be accessible whereas those with higher service IDs are ignored.

    This interface is intended to be implemented by feature providers.
    See Also:
    Feature, FeatureGroup, FeatureService

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Optional<String> getDescription()
      The description of the strategy.
      String getName()
      The name of the strategy.
      boolean isEnabled(Strategizable strategizable, Map<String,Object> properties)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        The name of the strategy.
        Returns:
        The name of this strategy which must not be null or an empty string

      • getDescription

        Optional<String> getDescription()
        The description of the strategy.
        Returns:
        The optional description of this strategy wrapped in Optional or empty Optional instance

      • isEnabled

        boolean isEnabled(Strategizable strategizable,
                  Map<String,Object> properties)
        This method is responsible to decide whether a feature is active or not. The implementation can use the custom configuration parameters of the strategy stored in the feature and information from the currently acting user to find a decision.
        Parameters:
        strategizable - The Strategizable instance to check for enablement
        properties - The service properties of the specified Strategizable instance
        Returns:
        true if the strategizable should be enabled, otherwise false
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any of the specified arguments is null
